. It lies on the R421 regional road, just north of the Slieve Bloom Mountains. It is about 20 km from Tullamore and 6 km from Kinnitty.

value: content=The Church and its grounds contain a cross inscribed grave slab, a 12th century decorated animal head and a human face, possibly Saint Lugna. It is possible that these stones, as well as many more used in constructing Cadamstown, were originally from the Church at Letter
content=Silver River Geological Reserve provides an insight into a landscape and the Silver River gorge

content=Ardara Bridge, a high arch spanning the Silver River, is of great architectural importance, being one of only a handful of such medieval bridges in Ireland. In 2006, the Office of Public Works acquired the bridge as a major conservation project was required to save the bridge from collapse, and to make it safe for public access.
content=It is the home of local historian Paddy Heaney who has written several books on historical events and folklore in the region, including
At the Foot of the Slieve Bloom
content=The village has many scenic walks including the start of the Offaly Way, a 29 km, long-distance walking trail linking the Slieve Bloom and Grand Canal Ways
